intro: Tagetes foetidissima, commonly known as the stinkweed or Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its bright yellow or orange flowers and its strong, often unpleasant odor. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Tagetes foetidissima is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
